reviewText:
I got it when it was on sale by 90%. The game is a piece of cake. I won my first race by tuning the handling and acceleration with a 3 star team in addition to buying all the top notch supplies.

The game can be a challenge if you handicap yourself, but otherwise, not really. It only gets easier and easier as you get sponsors, and as long as you win races, you can replace your parts very easily. Some parts get worn out to 50% after one race, but they cost less than 25-50k while winning a race gets you 1m. If you have two drivers, that can go up to 1.9m, and there are lots of free agents at the start to hire mad cheap. My salaries were 50k even though it said a 20k salary would guarantee a contract signing. It's very easy to hire personnel as well. You just have to make sure you're balanced.

For $2, it's worth it. For $20? Nuh uh.

reviewText:
Grade A+++ EPICFAIL.

Brilliant idea so poorly executed, full of glitches and absolute cone of silence from devs for patches. In it current state it's totally unplayable.

This game would be abandonware if someone was able to fix it.

Last patch was in May 2012....


Edit note : 8th March, 2014
- After some discussion on the RM2014 ( the recent released successor to PP2012 ), there has now been a patch update attempting to bring the game out of the totally broken stage it was left in. I will update this review further after iv'e checked the patch out.

Update : 30th March, 2014
- Still very broken, now crashes randomly so often I am unable to even test the game mechanics without wanting to burn my PC. Developer does not care and still sells this steaming pile of donkey excriment along with it's successor Racing Manager 2014 without fixing the game.

DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY !!!!, you have been warned, this game is really bad and totally unplayable, even if you engage in self mutilation, DO NOT BUY THIS.

reviewText: Unfortunately, this is a poor simulation of the formula racing world. The biggest weaknesses are a UI that takes a bit to figure out even with the tutorial" turned on which is nothing more than a description of each screen that you visit for the first time. Another glaring weakness is the simulation itself. The car mechanics
date: parts and driver abilities do not contribute to meanigful changes in the races. I stumbled upon a car setup that has allowed me to win every race with both my drivers taking the podium. I essentially am left with managing the wear and tear of parts.\n\nOn the surface
recommended: this game had me excited. I am sad to say it was a disappointment. I'm continuing to play it just to see what running through a 3-5 year period in the game looks like and then I will be removing it from my box."

reviewText:
I have never even seen a track. Apparently, I need to manufacture a car? And I have to read emails about people who want to drive for me. And then there are a million other little menus and things that I need to fiddle with in some kind of prescribed way before I have to click through several months of calendar dates until I arrive at a date that an event is supposed to happen, and yet... I never seen to get to a track with a completed car.

I signed up to be the driver, not an entire production team devoted to the task of getting me on the track.

I entered this with an open mind, but I can see why people hate this.

reviewText:
Do not bother with this utter tripe, I'd suggest getting United GP on iOS or MotorSport Manager on android (Links below) These have the same functionality, better packaged, written and streamlined and are not a complete waste of time, money or effort.

If I could get a refund I would, sadly I purchased this prior to steam issuing refunds so it'll be stuck in my library as a reminder of poor life choices & the fact a demo should be offered for all PC games, with the option topay for the full game if you wish to continue playing.

The fact that you know have to create an account in order to play a 4 year old game is amazing!

THIS GAME IS A WASTE OF TIME DO NOT GO NEAR IT!
